The inside of my car wasn't properly cleaned and wax was all over my car. Smh
Hughes Rd. location

name: Kristen Leonardi
text: We always bring our car here for a deep clean. The guys are always friendly and very efficient in detailing our vehicle. I definitely recommend bringing your car here to get it looking and smelling nice!

name: Mackenzie Akin
text: 10/10 would absolutely recommend these guys! My car was a wreck from having my dog in it so often and they made it look better than it did when I drove it off the lot. They were super nice and spent all day making sure my car was perfect. They kept me updated on when it would be ready and even offered to take me to work while it was being cleaned. Amazing dudes!

name: Mitch Wright
text: These guys are amazing. They will take care of you and you won't be disappointed. This is the only place I will go to. Honest and do not try and rip you off. I love this place and send everyone I know to them. Not a bad thing to say from me and all my friends that use them.

resp.text: Thank you so much

resp.text: Thank for coming to see us.

text: Get it done Car Care in Florence located across from burger depot does amazing job for an amazing price. I get my car cleaned every other week and have always been satisfied. They also accept credit cards so that's good for me because I don't keep cash on me. Keep it up guys! Satisfied customer.

name: Anthony Cooper
text: Great bunch of guys, they took my Grand Cherokee right in and it came back to me sparkling...lots of attention to detail and pride in work.

text: The guys at the shop did an excellent job.   Very professional and great prices.  They took good care of my X3. Great customer service. I'll definitely be back!! Thank y'all so much

name: Andrew Springer

name: Michael Henderson
text: They get my car in and out for any service needs!

text: I needed to have my front windows tinted to match my rear windows and am very satisfied with my experience and tinting. Everyone was very friendly and worked quickly to take of my service even though I did not have an appointment. I was in and out in under an hour. The prices are competitive and I feel like I got a great value.

name: Kathleen Dillard

name: Dorian Wigfall
text: Got my wife remote start done here great service great customer service fast and professional work

name: Phillip Malbrough
text: Stopped by around 3 o'clock on a Monday afternoon to see about getting some window tint and car audio work done. The lights were on, the "OPEN" neon sign was on, but the door was locked and no one was around; so I called the phone #. I got an answer, and he said he stepped out for lunch. That's fine and understandable, but at 3 o'clock in the afternoon? With no one around to help customers that may come by? That's no way to run a business; at least put a sign on the door or something, or get a secretary to handle things while you're gone. I started to wait for someone to return, but I figured; Why should I? I can just take my business elsewhere. Then I looked through the reviews, and noticed I wasn't the only person that's had this happen here before.

name: BoSslaDi James
text: They weren't able to assist me!

name: Katie Jo Gossett
text:
They have
Done two of my cars and i haven't had a problem out of the quality of work. Always nice and clean. I will continue to use them in the future with other vehicles

name: jarvis shell
text: Where do i start... Mr. Collins treated me like a customer and like he wanted my business. Unlike their neighbors who seemed to only be half interested in make a sell. He asked what I was looking for and gave me the best options to meet me needs and budget. My car sounds REALLY REALLY GOOD!!! I normally look at online reviews to help me make a decision on making purchases, but I didnt do that when I decided to have my sounds installed by Collins. 3.1 stars is not accurate based on what I am reading from dissatisfied ppl. I got my system installed in the midst of a pandemic. COLLINS IS THE TRUTH!!! I will have 2 friends to go get systems installed soon because of how excellent my car sounds! Thanks for your service Mr. Collins and professionalism. Wishing you many more years of profitable business! Keep up the good work!

name: Richard Carr
text: Great jobs as always.

name: XXPROREAPSXX
text: Mr. Collins tinted my windows on my truck and he did an awesome job.  I would recommend anyone to Collins Custom Tinting & Sound.

name: Jakira Brown
text: He did an excellent job on my tints!

name: Shag Harris
text: I have used him on all my vehicles. Great service, great warranty. Very happy with the product.

name: Mike Who
text: Called around all of Montgomery n Prattville n they had the best price n the only ones to get me n same day. Nice office/shop. Will def use again n refer others too.

name: Kyle Brock
text: Gary gave me the option to install my already purchased head-unit.  Quick install, professional service and the system works great.  Thanks!

name: Jennifer Austin
text: If you want incredibly rude customer service, higher prices than competitors, and a receptionist to hang up on you, this is the place for you! Bought a $160 gift certificate for my husband to get his windows tinted. Didn't think to ask if it also covered the sun strip across the windshield... well it didn't, that's an extra $25. Husband priced tinting somewhere else $30 cheaper and it DID cover the sun strip. The not so pleasant receptionist was very uncooperative and even hung up on him. WILL NOT recommend this place nor will we ever do business with this place again!

name: YamaKesha Thompson
text: HORRIBLE, TERRIBLE, UNPROFFESSIONAL! I MADE 2 APPOINTMENTS AT THIS PLACE. 1ST APPOINTMENT THEY NEVER CALLED TO SAY THEY WASN'T GOING TO BE IN ON THAT DAY. SO I DROVE FROM CLANTON, AL & TO MY SURPRISE NO ONE WAS THERE. 2ND APPOINTMENT I LEFT MY CAR AS AT 7:30AM AS I WAS TOLD, I STARTED CALLING AT 9:10, NO ANSWER, SO I DECIDED TO TAKE A TRIP BACK UP & TO MY SURPRISE CAR STILL IN SAME SPOT I LEFT IT & OPEN SIGN WASNT ON, SO I ASSUMED THEY WASN'T IN YET UNTIL A CUSTOMER PULLED ON THE DOOR. SO I WALKED IN BEHIND THEM ONCE THEY WAS GIVEN THE PRICES, THEY TOOK A CARD & WALKED OUT. I THEN TOLD THEM MY SITUATION, SHE CALLED THE OWNER & HE CLAIM HE NEVER KNEW ABOUT MY APPT, BUT THE GIRL LOOKED IN THE BOOK & CALL MY NAME OUT TO ME. SO I WALKED OUT & DECIDED TO TAKE MY BUSINESS TO "PROFESSIONAL GLASS TINTING" ON FAIRVIEW AVENUE. OPEN 6 DAYS A WEEK & IS PROFESSIONAL, CHEAPER BUT SAME WORK & HAS CUSTOMER SKILLS.

text: ADR recently did outstanding fender repair work on my Lexus.  Doug, is very personable and a professional business owner.  He provided me a fair estimate, quick response, and excellent results.  He made sure that the repair was done correctly ... the paint job matched perfectly.  Kevin was also very efficient in handling the scheduling and paperwork.  They seem to be very customer oriented and are concerned about providing quality service.  I would definitely recommend them to others.

name: Spencer JHOG
text: Picked up my F250 today and I am super satisfied!!! Brought it in with a MAJOR dent on the right front fender that ran across a body line and now it looks like new! I've been a car nut all my life and know how hard a dent like this is to fix and Doug and Kevin blew me away. Incredible talent. OK, it is darn near a two decade old pickup but it made my day to see my baby looking good. These old Fords have some tough steel in them so I'm sure it was way more work than what the bill reflected. Thanks!!!

name: Roy Gambino
text: True professionals! I rarely write a review for anything, but was so impressed with Alabama Dent Repair (Kevin and his team) that I wanted to give them a shout out.  I have a relatively new Jeep Gladiator that suffered a small dent (ding) on the left rear quarter panel.  I'm always particular about where I park and absolutely hate dents/dings on vehicles. Alabama Dent Repair performed a paintless dent repair (PDR) on the damage and the dent/ding has literally disappeared.  It exceeded my expectations of what could be done and I couldn't be happier!  I contemplated purchasing one of the PDR kits on Amazon and attempting the repair myself...  Then I thought better - "Let a professional do it right the first time..."  So glad I did!  For the price of a cheap PDR kit on Amazon, Alabama Dent Repair removed the dent/ding better than I ever could have hoped to.  Good to know there are businesses out that that still care, deliver on their promises, and all for a very fair price.  Thanks again Kevin!

resp.text: Thanks so much Roy for the kind word you spoke about us. If you need anything else please give us a call first. I will do what can to help you. It was a great pleasure meeting you.

name: Kathleen Jackson
text: I've been dealing with the owner Doug for years he's always been my go to guy with all of my cars and I've always been completely satisfied with the work and price. The Staff at ADR are always professional  and friendly. I wouldn't recommend going anywhere else! Thanks Doug!!!!

resp.text: Thank you so much Kathleen for letting us work on your camaro. It's always a pleasure to help you

text: I'm pretty disappointed w/ this group. I hear they do solid work. I can't verify that though because I couldn't get them to respond or do the work. I drove by there, talked to the owner. He said he'd call back that day w/ some options and thoughts. Never called. I reached out two or three times on FB...one response then nothing. I called the office multiple time, left some messages. Nothing. I suppose if you can't get much comms on the front side, makes me a little worried about the comms during the process. Idk...I run a business myself, so this sort of thing is just odd to me. Again, they may do fine work; maybe not. It's possible they only go after the major insurance bucks and don't care about individual customers. That's also fine...just say that so you don't waste individual people's time I suppose.

resp.text: Hey there Josh I just wanted to once again tell you I'm very sorry about not getting back in touch with you. At the time when we was talking I was very short on staff and let our conversation slip thru the cracks. I do want you to know that we look at every customer the same, whether they are insurance or self pay. Again I'm so sorry that we give you a bad feeling and do appreciate you letting us know what we did wrong. We are trying our best to correct these issues so it doesn't happen again.  Again thanks and have a great day

The owner, Doug Newton, and his entire staff are highly trained with many years experience. Recon Techs Huntsville also offers the entire line of Professional Grade and Performance Guaranteed Recon Techs Detail Products and is the exclusive Certified Installation Center for Tsunami Nano Ceramic High Performance Coatings in the Huntsville area.

You can trust your car, truck, motorcycle,RV, ATV, boat or aircraft to Recon Techs Huntsville if you want the job done right !!

text: I have a new 2020 Toyota, I was at the Medical Mall Monday standing outside next to my car a SUV parked next to me and swung the door open and dented my car and chipped the paint, carried my car to Alabama Dent Repair this morning my car was repaired while I waited, Doug the owner was the person who fixed my car and touched up the paint, when he finished I had to ask where the dent was before I brought it in, it looked just as it did the day I bought the car, Doug is a friendly and professional person and his staff is also, I highly recommend this business who wants the job done right, it is a one stop shop, if I have any more problems I won't even call anywhere else, I'll go to Alabama Dent Repair, the cost of the repair was half of what I was expecting to pay, they also do a variety of work other than dent repair I just can't say enough about this business.

name: ashley brink
text: I brought my vehicle in and was under the impression I would pick it up looking better than it did after my wreck. I understand it's not a 40k vehicle but feel like there was a lack of reguard altogether. Their was no prep work on my brush guard and the damage from the wreck wasnt even sanded before paint. Here we are a a week later the  new paint is peeling off already. It was repainted  and then pulled out and there is white paint from the equipment  used, and stands out considering it is black. I stated multiple times when  I dropped it off that I was not concerned about the grill and the 3 scratch marks it had but now it is painted black, and looks like a weird replacement, considering all the accents are grey. I have no clue where the black came from  unless it was around the time the grill was being painted and they just ran with it. I am kicking myself for not swapping the panel and brush guard myself. You live and learn I guess.

resp.text: Hi Ashley I'm so sorry about you being unhappy with your repair and love to try and take care of it. If you was unhappy please just say something and we will be glad to try and make it right. I definitely want to make sure my customers are pleased with their repairs. At your convenience please come by so we can go over the repair and I will do what I can to correct it.

name: Oneal Jordan
text:
I was recently referred to The Tint Shop from a Auto dealership where I purchased a used car.   I mentioned we had just purchased a used Lexus RX350 from the Lexus dealership but the paint did not feel smooth.   The manager recommended a ceramic coating from Tint Shop since we did not purchase our vehicle from their dealership.
I phoned Seth and he was very professional.   Gave me the estimate and detailed what was involved and would take a complete day to finish.   We  agreed and set a date for my wife's Lexus to be coated.
When we picked up the car, we were informed by Seth that the reason the paint felt gritty was due to a light film of paint on the car.   The Lexus dealership was undergoing outside renovations when we bought the car.
Seth indicated he sent the car to a body shop for buffing then they applied the ceramic coating.
The car looks like NEW!   My wife has gotten several compliments on the appearance of the car...and I'm a hero!!
Although there was extra expense in having the car buffed, Seth stood behind his price and delivered when he promised.
Great team and I highly recommend their services.

The fellas explain to me the different types of films and has a display that explains what ceramic can do for your interior.(reduce the heat built up inside your vehicle over the long hot summer days) Fellas, you guys rock not only the music you listen to while you're working but also your business as will. Thanks again guys all the best to you and your business.

LLumar tint has a nation wide lifetime warranty and is very durable. The tint doesn’t change colors/fade like those cheaper tints.  Cheaper is not better and you’ll only end up replacing the tint, costing more money in the end.
Scheduling an appointment at Oasis tinting is pain free and they normally have plenty of options.
His business has now expanded to residential installation. So next on my list is for him to do my house windows!
This is a top notch business to do work for you.

name: Cameron Grace
text: I had windows tinted on May 29.  First indication I should have left was when the price in person increased from the phone price. I went ahead anyway.  They ran my vehicle the entire time while working (1 1/2 hrs) even after my request not to do so. Their explanation was the battery would discharge otherwise.  I have had numerous vehicles tinted and have never incurred this problem.  Upon inspection, many ares of small bubbles were noted.  They insisted they were water bubbles and said they would go away. I returned on June 4 to address the bubbles that remained.  The employee still insisted they were air bubbles and to give a few more days.  I returned on June 13 (my next opportunity).  The man in charge asked for my receipt and said that I was past my warranty for replacement and there was nothing he would do.  I would not recommend this shop simply because they do not stand behind their work.  I had returned (June 4) within the warranty time frame (14 days) and they sent me away insisting the problem would go away.  The problem remains.  All they want is your money, not your business.  I wish I would have received the same service the other review received.  Go elsewhere!

text: This was the worst experience I have ever had at any automotive accessory shop. On 3 July I took my GS350 to have the tint removed from my rear glass and have it replaced with ceramic tint that I purchased from tintzoom online for $200.00. When I arrived the owner and I agreed on a price of $190.00 to do all window with the exception of the left front and left rear (I had already installed it) with the tint I supplied. Having done over 50 tint jobs at a reputable local shop while in college (10 years ago) I know the proper way of installing tint, but being a little rusty I decided to take it to a professional to ensure the tint was removed properly (Steamer or Ammonia and Black Bag). After pulling the car into the shop to start the job I noticed the CARWASH DETAILER with a razor blade hacking at the tint in the rear window. I immediately asked him to stop and asked the owner to take over before he ruin the rear glass defroster. I then left with my ride that was waiting (big mistake) and had him take me to the bank to get cash for the job.  When I returned my car was supposedly ready. I looked at my rear package and it was covered with tint scrapings and my defrost lines were no longer black they were gold (as in no longer working from scraping with a razor). I also noticed that my 3rd brake light was torn to pieces, and there were several pieces of tint left on the window with new film laid on top of it. Soon after I spoke with the manager to inform him of my displeasure with the services rendered. The first thing I asked the owner about was my 3rd brake light and his answer was “We had to break it to put the film on.” The second was my defroster his response was” We had to get the tint off.” The third issue with this humbling experience was the patches of old tint eft on the window with new tint installed over it, in which I received no response from the owner. My response to the owner was “I am not paying for this,” so he decided to vacuum some of the tint from the rear package tray and reduce the price to $165.00 since he broke my $250.00 3rd brake light. After I still refused to pay we both called the police (Little did he know I was on the phone with a good friend who is deputy chief of police). So between the times the police arrived he decided to rip the tint off the windows and throw my $200.00 ceramic tint in the trash, despite his wife warning him not to. When the police arrived he lied about ripping the tint off and even said I didn’t bring any tint to him and stated that he supplied the tint. After looking at the car the officer asked why is there just tint on the driver side windows, I stated that is because those were the windows I did myself. To end the story the officers did nothing (OF COURSE) and stated it was a civil matter which is probably true. Long story short I am out $568.49 to replace the rear glass to get my defrosters back (plus installation), $200.00 for the ceramic tint that he decided to rip from the window and throw in the trash, and $250.00 for my 3rd brake light the he tore up. PLEASE do not go to the poor established called Customized Auto Detail & Window Tinting or you will receive a humbling experience like mine.

text: Most unprofessional bussiness that I have ever encountered. First off there was nobody in the front office I waited 20 minutes to get a quote. Then I went into garage to get some help the guy said "boss man will be back later just wait". So I waited about 20 minutes nobody came. I then called the number on front of the building and this Tyrone character answered. This fool said "you should have just walked in the front and asked for help". I told him I did they told me to wait on you. I went back into garage they told me to wait again. Then this idiot Tyrone called me back 3 times! "Get the f@$k out my shop" blah blah. I told him why are you calling me I already told you I don't want your bussiness bye. The owner is an idiot. I wouldn't go there for a window tint if he said he would pay me. Enter at your own risk.

name: S Colbert
text:
I was a first time customer to Elite Car Spa. I took my vehicle here as recommended by a trusted friend. I purchased the highest level service they provided (well over $200), a "full detail" as they said. I had my vehicle there a full day with no pressure to have it done at any certain time, as i wouldn't be able to pick it up until i was out of work, well after they had closed. Upon arrival to pick it up, I was immediately concerned. It seemed as if they overlooked quite a few obvious areas. The front-end still had smashed insects and debris on it that easily came off with my fingernail. That lead me to look even closer. Using a flashlight, I noticed quite a few areas where wax was never removed, where hopefully condensation, and not unrinsed soap, dripped down, leaving behind hazy but obvious lines across the paint. The interior of my vehicle was outstanding, with the exception of the entire front winshield being ignored and unclean. I am just disappointed. I apologize in !
advance for not having enough faith in this shop to bring my vehicle back there, even for them to correct these issues. I do believe that this may be the best place in town for a basic car wash, but i would not reccomended them to someone expecting expertly trained, skillful, adept work or to even get what they paid for. Even if they in fact paid for the best the have to offer.

resp.text:
We're sorry to hear that you were not satisfied with the services provided.
There are several issues you addressed. Unfortunately, we dont have an S.Colbert in our customer database making it difficult to know what vehicle you are referring to and unable to review your account.
We're glad you were pleased with the interior work done in your vehicle. As for exterior work, bugs can etch into your clear coat and without having your vehicle buffed it would seem rough. Picking up your vehicle at night, when condensation builds up, does make it difficult to see.  Not to say there wasn't an issue as we are human. However, we pride ourself on our work and professionalism.
We love feedback from our customers. On rare occasions when a customer is not satisfied we do go above and beyond to make sure to rectify any issues. It is unfortunate you don't feel comfortable enough to bring your vehicle back to us as we would have done everything we could to make sure you were 100% satisfied.
We are far more than a basic car wash and our staff is trained and quite skilled.
We hope you call and give us an opportunity to rectify this situation.

text: I'm the VP for the Buckhorn High School football quarterback club and we had a flat tire on our equipment trailor that we had brought to our game versus Cullman High School. They are wonderful people that care about their community and will go above and beyond to provide exceptional customer service! I would recommend Branham for any automotive needs you may have.  Branham needs to open a store in Huntsville!

text: I took my 2017 Suburban in for an electrical issue, and I am so glad to say this shop restores my faith in humanity. First they were too busy to really dig into my problem, but a super nice mechanic, Phillip, spent a fair amount of time narrowing down the problem and advising me that he didn’t want to charge me for unnecessary repairs. He further advised that he believed a Chevy dealership would need to look into it, as it I was probably computer related. This is how a business should operate. They have won my business forever and I recommend them to anyone reading this. Bravo! Thank you!

resp.text: Thank you David for trusting in us to take care of you and your vehicle needs. We appreciate you !

Ryan

He then told me to buy another cord and they'd put it in for me... Hmmm 🤔 not sure who wins in that arrangement, but I know it isn't me. After spending for the cord initially, then installation... to then be told to repurchase the cord. One that obviously got messed up from the installation. This is not even poor customer service, it's the epitome of probably one of the most dishonest things I've ever witnessed in doing business with an installer. name: April Blankenship
text:
Addendum:

Owners response not accurate.  First of all, not one point that her made was articulated to me or to my husband.  Just because you are busy (South Alabama in the heat), doesn't mean you handle your business well.
I just say buyer beware.  If you need warranty work later due to poor placement or product, you will not be a priority.  Cash talks.  Also, this was a very hot day and my car sat for three hours after being driven for an hour.  My offer stands at the very least to help you with your poor communication to your customers and lack of expectations being stated.

Appointments here may be firm on the customer’s calendar, but it is OPTIONAL to the business owner.

We made an appointment for 0800 on our day off, a day to usually sleep in just a bit, and arrived on time for a scheduled front window tint replacement on one car and rear window tint replacement on the other. Rear tint has bubbled significantly from original install on my car.

First car done by 0915. Instead of breathing down the owners neck, we said we would run some errands or grab a bite to eat while he worked on my car.

As soon as we were pulling out, they pulled a four door red sedan into the bay. I turned to Rob and said, “We have an appointment, what about my car?”  Rob thought they could pull two cars in the bay and do the work simultaneously. That may be true, but it certainly wasn’t my car they pulled in behind the sedan.

We arrived approximately three hours later to pick up my car, which was sitting in the same place I left it and was untouched. To say I was frustrated is the understatement of the year.

I asked the owner about our scheduled appointment and he very nonchalantly said “we don’t always keep the cars in order of appointment.” WHAT?!?!

Lessons learned:
Appointments are a suggestion not a firm time to conduct agreed upon work as scheduled.

Warranty work (bubbled original ceramic tint) goes to the back of the line, despite having a confirmed appointment.

New customers do not need an appointment because you can just slide into the appointment made by a warranty customer-DON’T WORRY!!!

I have taught service most of my career. In this economy, I would expect much better service and a commitment to a returning customer even if it was for warranty work.  PRO TIP for ProTint-satisfied return customers are loyal customers that will recommend you to their friends and acquaintances.

I would rather the guy tell me to my face that there is no way he is going to honor my appointment if he has cash coming in-honesty, I can deal with rationally.

His attitude was not apologetic and instead was very nonchalant.

I will not be recommending this business to anyone.

I am the most understanding and benevolent person that you will ever meet; however, not when being blown off and taken for granted.

Shame on you ProTint. Very poor service. Let me know if you need some business coaching!

BTW-third automobile tinted here.
#bottomline

resp.text:
“We don’t always keep cars in the order of appointment“ was not said AT ALL.  That’s a total fabrication.

What WAS said was (multiple times), was “removals are not given a guaranteed time frame”.  Ever.

You also can not remove window film from a cold back window on a BMW (so, baking in the sun is one of many steps required). If a vehicle is not ready for certain steps, it must wait until it is.  If you attempt to pull film off a cold BMW window, it will also pull the defroster lines with it.  If destroying the lines is acceptable, we could have accommodated that, but we prefer not to damage something.

We also “never” (99%+ of the time) do any warranty work on Saturdays.  Saturdays are exclusively for straight installs. We made an exception (for not just one, but TWO vehicles). We do to take warranty’s without a receipt (we made an exception. You may have one, we haven’t seen it).  We NEVER remove film if we did not install it.

You did not mention that the vehicle that WAS done, was a “warranty” that ONLY ProTint will do.  You broke a windshield on a SUBARU BRZ and we tinted the new windshield with the 85% clear ceramic for $0.00, under our exclusive warranty (which would normally be $150.00+), 100% free replacement is nearly unheard of.  With any other shop.

ANY retint comes with NO completion time guarantee.  That has been the policy for 30 years, will continue to be so.

The order that vehicles are pulled into the shop is of no one’s concern other than staff.  The car that was pulled in at 9am (Dodge Charger) was already an hour late on starting, they also drove from out of the area and paid in advance, and had to wait in person.  The BRZ (that was not being charged for) was stacked in on top of their spot.

While we can appreciate your frustration, that doesn’t change that window tinting is not a snap your fingers and it’s done type of process.  Redo’s in particular take MANY hours.  Some take more than an entire day (which is why we stopped doing them).  Waiting around (or leaving for just a little while) for a REDO is not something that can be done.

I appreciate the business coaching offer, but being being booked 3 weeks out, we can’t take any further work.  We will stop trying to help people out, but putting them into an already full schedule though.

I believe the company is closing and I was the last job they did using leftover scrap pieces from previous jobs. Do not use this company unless I update this review.

name: Garrett Donnelly
text: Sent a quote request via their website since no one ever answers the phone and have yet to hear back from them.. 3 stars because the information might be out of date; Heard good things here and there so wanted to use them.. Will take business else where.

name: Sue Stewart
text: product advertised on Marketplace NEVER RECEIVED. Paid cash in full. It was supposedly  shipped 2/21/2021. Ignores texts, phone calls & messages. along with any & All numbers I can find. If Damien is this dishonest, I would NOT TRUST him with my car.

name: Brandon Wheeler
text: This review is to show and warn people about this place. I’ve had at least 10 cars tinted and re tinted in my lifetime and this is by far the worst experience I’ve ever had. On April 23rd I dropped my car off the night before so it could be done the first thing the next morning Damien the new owner assured me that they had plenty of time to get it done. After I waited around all day I finally call and ask about my car around 5pm he said it will be done shortly so my family went to eat to kill some more time. At 730pm! I get a text that it’s about done. At 9pm! I get another text saying it’s about done so I went ahead and went there. Still not done! Didn’t get my car till 10pm! And when I got it you can just tell when something was rushed. I keep my car spotless when I got it back glue was everywhere! And after looking at the tint (in the first 4 pictures)the tint didn’t go all the way into the gaskets and the front windshield didn’t go all the way up! Also cluster bubbles everywhere! I know some are expected but they where horrible. After talking to him the next day he wanted to make it right and I agreed because I felt he would do a way better job next time. Wrong! On May 2nd took my car back around 10am so they could get it back to me at a decent time. 6pm! Told me to come get it when I went there still wasn’t done! The tint now didn’t go to the back of the rear gaskets in 3 out of 4 windows! And debris all in my back window! Including tint coming off the top of my front window which he said I need to leave up for 3 days! I’ve never heard of that so I did and that happened when I finally rolled them down(The last 6 photos posted) I texted him the pictures and called he avoided me. So I needed a witness to go there with me I showed him Everything again and he said it needed touched up and one window would need re done. He said the way my windows move is why he couldn’t get them to go all the way into the gaskets. And said nothing could be done about that. Lies! After asking for a refund because he said nobody could do a better job he just starred at my car and my dad said what if someone can do a better job and we will bring you the bill. He said ok. Well I went somewhere else and had it redone they did everything I wanted the right way! I called and texted him about a refund and he said because they took his film off he is keeping my money! $325. Bottom line if you are a business that offers a %100 guaranteed job or if your customer is not happy you refund them! So just think twice about going here it isn’t the same place it was a few years ago.

name: Alivia Busch
text: He was super nice when he came to do my windows. He did good on my side windows and when he got to back window it was getting late and said he'd come finish the next day. He said he was on the way and never showed i tried to call, email and text but haven't heard anything. Now I have an unfinished tint job.

name: Matthew Sweeten
text: Went to get my windows tinted and paint protection film done on my brand new BMW loved the work that Damien and his team did made sure everything was done properly. Had an issue with the tint not sticking properly due to the window catching it was fixed without question. Sadly the car was totaled about a month and a half later however will be bringing my next BMW to home and his staff

name: Thomas Calix
text:
I took my New 2014 Equus to Daphne tinting for a paint protective film over my entire front end.
Damien was very helpful initially over the phone answering all my questions and helping me to feel confident in the process. This was a very new experience for me.  I've never owned an over $50k car before much less had a process like this done.
The guys worked from 10 am to 1100 PM that night so I didn't have to leave it and travel back and forth.  I live in Destin,  Florida...
Flawless job. . Check these guys out and tell them Tom ...the equus guy sent you... ..thanks again guys greeeeeaaat job...

name: Drayton Perkins
text:
Had a previous car tinted here and loved the level of detail that was put into the work.

Made an appointment to get two cars tinted here while we were in town from Atlanta. The business was listed as “open” online, but when we showed up to our appointment, the office was locked and the phones were unavailable.

Would recommend their work - if you can be sure they’ll be there to do it.

name: Kurro Howard
text:
Set up an appointment via phone call. All sounded well & we confirmed an appointment for today. I attempted to call again the day before my appointment to confirm- calls were never answered, mailbox full, email wasn't responded to, and facebook messenger ignored. It was a fluke I got through the first time.

Best part? They didn't show up today.
Put everything on hold in the event they did.

And you expect a warranty on your tint service to be honored, in the event you see it's a bad job after you're able to roll your windows down?

name: James S
text: This is not the company you want to touch your car. When Damien took ownership of Daphne tint. It has since went into the toilet. My experience with Damien has been very unprofessional. His work is not good, he tried several times to tint my windows. Between trash stuck under the tint where he did not clean the surface or simply cut to small to fit my window. He has left me with a mess of tint that I had to remove myself, and made off with my money and refuses to answer my texts or calls to repair his shotty work. If you want quality work, do not go here. He charges the same as better shops, and does not have the skill set. If I could rate less then 1 star I would.

name: Leah volz
text: 5 stars and 2 thumbs up to Daphne Tinting!! I've used them for 2 of my vehicles and these guys do a great job. With my mini van the window made a snap sound and then the window fell into the door. They got me in that day diagnosed the problem, order the part, made the window weather proof, made an appointment a day later and back on the road good as new!!

Now you’re MIA and haven’t come back to tint my home windows or redo the truck windows that have imperfections. I have tried calling and texting, but have had no response.

But everyone in the shop is very nice.

text: I thought I had already put up a review. Apperently not. Oasis is awesome I've been uaing him since my civic si I believe. Then for my Nismo 370Z. He goes out of his way for each customer and their needs. The air 80 was printed on the actual tint so he took care of me with a return visit and discounted some for gas and time. I'm now about 2 hours away and now that I picked up my new car. I'm still trying to work a way to get in to see him. I'm so piticular that even a spec drives me crazy. Oasis knew that about me and even redid a window before I said anything because he saw a speck. One window a week or so later did start the come down. Oasis fit me in no problems or questions and had me out in 30 minutes. He doesn't give you high pricing or revommend things you don't need. My 370z looked the same as the day he finished it as when I sold it. ~2 years later. I've used a lot of other tinters, 3 just in mobile. None of them came clost to the quality you get from this business and the owner is a down to earth great guy. For me to leave this kind of review is extremly rare. I just feel bad that I didn't do it sooner I thought I had.

name: Jon Klein
text:
Let me tell you a story about how I was treated and how my car looks.

First off I've never had a tint job done on my car before. I was always hesitant about getting one done because I would be out money and it wouldn't look perfect.

James the owner of Hi Tech tint walked me through the whole process from beginning to end. I never felt like I was getting over on either. He's a real personable person who cares just as much about the car as you do.

My tint job is flawless. I had one window that had bubbles form and James took the car and said "we are going to make this right." He re did the window and now it's just amazing. He has a lifetime warranty on all his tint and his work which really put my mind as ease.

I can't say enough good things about this place. He's a real stand up guy who knows what he's doing. He takes care of your car and uses high quality tint. If the job doesn't look right the first time he will get it right for you and even answers the phones after business hours.

This place is an A+ by my standards. Thank you so much for the job you did on my beautiful car.
